greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) = Sum_{k<=n} A000203(k)*(n-k+1), where A000203(m) is the sum of divisors of m.
comment: Partial sums of A024916. - _Omar E. Pol_, Jul 03 2014
a(n) is also the volume of the stepped pyramid with n levels described in A245092. - _Omar E. Pol_, Aug 12 2015
Also the alternating row sums of A262612. - _Omar E. Pol_, Nov 23 2015
Convolution of A340793 and the nonzero terms of A000217.
link: Indranil Ghosh, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..2209
formula: Conjecture: a(n) = Sum_{k=0..n} A006218(n-k). - _R. J. Mathar_, Oct 17 2012
G.f.: (1/(1 - x)^2)*Sum_{k>=1} k*x^k/(1 - x^k). - _Ilya Gutkovskiy_, Jan 03 2017
a(n) = Sum_{k=1..n} Sum_{i=1..k} k - (k mod i). - _Wesley Ivan Hurt_, Sep 13 2017
mathematica: Table[Sum[DivisorSigma[1, k] (n - k + 1), {k, n}], {n, 45}] (* _Michael De Vlieger_, Nov 24 2015 *)
program: (PARI) a(n) = sum(x=1, n, sigma(x)*(n-x+1)) \\ _Michel Marcus_, Mar 18 2013
results.author: _Jaroslav Krizek_, Mar 14 2010
